text:
Please can anyone let me or <@U0TFEHX8E> know if getting the latest code from master and rebuilding your dev-env caused any issue (with the new reassignment of ports)

[Re: the merge of <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/289>]

Hi, I read somewhere that the clients need to be paired to a peer that will then handle their certificates (ECA, TCA) on behalf of the clients.
I guess this is the purpose of the "Login" function of the DevOps API. It is not reflected in <@U1C86FGBX>'s work, so is this workflow "temporary"? Thanks.
I don't think that <@U1C86FGBX>'s slides are correct. I wrote to him about it. The very early registration part is fine (obtaining the ECert)
Ok, I'll dig further in the code to understand this. This kind of diagram is absolutely needed in the documentation :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U11MANG9G>: Would you mind pointing out the specific parts where you think Xavier's diagram is not right?
It's important, since many people are using it to understand the membership services (since it's a very cool diagram), but it might generate misunderstanding among us.

Hi, so a few things... I think it would be more helpful to break down the Membership Services box into the services others are calling (I am assuming the RA is in the original box of Membership Services).
E.g., you get the ECert from the ECA, getting the TCert from the TCA.
The Membership Service box, in the diagram, changes in the next section to a Certificate Authority

In the diagram there is more back and forth between A(lice) and B(ob) than in real life (noting that the key exchange in Fabric is very different than the Bitcoin protocol, in case this is the/a source of confusion)
Most of the communication/exchanges in such systems is done through the Blockchain itself (and not directly between Alice and Bob)

I think that it's important to go into the Attributes (detail) of the Asset Transfer case, because that's where it's 1) more complicated 2) more important, and IMO, this is Fabric's Membership Services biggest strength.
I have a lot of diagrams that we used during the design/planning of some of these features... that I will happily share.
These might need some work/cleaning-up/updating, but as I said, I'd be super happy to work with others and contribute these back to the community.
There's nothing 'confidential' there, as all the code and architecture is already out here in Fabric (github and Gerrit)... it's just a matter of cleaning this up and putting it together for reviews.
For example:
<@U11MANG9G|jonathanlevi> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/jonathanlevi/F1XFLGN8J/screen_shot_2016-08-02_at_9.52.18_am.png|Screen Shot 2016-08-02 at 9.52.18 AM.png>

I put many of such flow diagrams together with David Kravitz back in April... some of this (in one form or another are already in GitHub/the wiki etc.)... but yes, we can certainly do more to clarify.

<@U11MANG9G>: hello, are you referring to the design/planning we (the IBM ARC security team) did at Almaden on April with David?  
if so, let us know so we (the IBM ARC security team) can review the diagrams to decide which ones are the most appropriate (and updated) to share. The diagrams changed in the latest weeks and you might not have the latest version. Thanks!
Yes, these ones. Most of them need to be updated/cleaned-up etc... and then we should probably add them to the Wiki...
I emailed you these charts back then.
I'll dig back and find these.
Yes, I agree, that will contribute to the documentation on membership services. And yes, I have them, David sent them too when we finished working on the design at that point.
Thanks!
Also, I have to update the colors... I don't know if purple and pink are the still the right colors! Prince tribute, aside... !
There is also Andres' chart that was checked-in as part of the ABAC  feature/documentation which details these steps...
I think we should all work out a unified front to each of these flows... so that we not only use the same terms...
.... but that it all looks more consistent.
yes, and <@U140PKXQQ> did the derivation for attributes, and the TCert keys diagrams. I will ask them to collect the latest versions
sure np!
Awesome. I'm trying to find the nice flow diagram that was checked in...
This one: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/docs/images/attributes_flow.png>

attachments.title: hyperledger/fabric
attachments.text: Read-only historic repo. Current development is at <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/admin/projects/fabric> . pull requests not accepted

text: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/docs/tech/attributes.md>

attachments.text: Read-only historic repo. Current development is at <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/admin/projects/fabric> . pull requests not accepted

text: <@U11MANG9G>: we need to modify the sequence diagram you pasted above so it complies with the UML standards
Sounds good!
<@U140PKXQQ>: agreed, and I think it should include the latest changes.
I agree too.
More generally, maybe a few more of these diagrams to support/enhance that attributes.md sound like a needed/requested improvement that should not be difficult to add.
That's what I meant yesterday, when I saw the (welcomed!) charts <@U1C86FGBX> posted.
I think these can clarify a lot.
I agree, it is a work in progress given that we are designing the new version for attributes handling/attestation, once done we will provide the documentation for the new version.
Take your time!
Don’t worry all this is already defined and planned in our milestones :wink:
